intro: Acer truncatum subsp. quelpaertense, commonly known as the Jeju maple, is a deciduous tree native to Jeju Island, South Korea. It is characterized by its distinctive heart-shaped leaves that turn vibrant red in the fall. The plant typically grows to a height of 5–10 meters and has a rounded crown. Its bark is smooth and reddish-brown, becoming fissured with age. It prefers well-drained soil and is often found in forested areas on the island.
